title: old-style cricket scoreboard
content:
Can anyone identify the font used on this 1920's cricket scoreboard? or suggest something with a similar feel?

sorry this image is small, but its all I have to go by.  
 [http://home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/high.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019190716/http:/home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/high.gif "http://home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/high.gif")

and the page it is from for more context:  
 [http://home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/history.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019190716/http:/home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/history.htm "http://home.vicnet.net.au/~cricket/history.htm")

Thanks in advance!

- Jen
author: jujube

comments.content: Take a look at the [Modesto](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019190716/http:/typedesign.com/fonts/modreg.html) family by Jim Parkinson.

Nice idea from a tough sample, marc. Also [Magnesium](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019190716/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=MVB.118644.0.0) and Parkinson's [FF Moderne Gothics](http://web.archive.org/) if you don't want serifs.
these are great! thank you, both.
